text:
News Releases

Payroll employment rises by 531,000 in October; unemployment rate edges down to 4.6% Total nonfarm payroll employment rose by 531,000 in October, and the unemployment rate edged down to 4.6 percent. Job gains occurred in leisure and hospitality, in professional and business services, in manufacturing, and in transportation and warehousing. Public education lost jobs.

| | | |

Real average hourly earnings for all employees decrease 0.5% in October Real average hourly earnings for all employees decreased 0.5 percent in October, seasonally adjusted. Average hourly earnings increased 0.4 percent and CPI-U increased 0.9 percent. Real average weekly earnings decreased 0.9 percent over the month.

| |

Next Release

The Employment Situation for November 2021 is scheduled to be released on December 3, 2021, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.

Real Earnings for November 2021 is scheduled to be released on December 10, 2021, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.
title: CES (National) : U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics
